intro: Dhofaria, commonly known as the Arabian desert rose, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Oman and the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate pink or white flowers that bloom during the cooler months. The plant has small, narrow leaves and thrives in well-drained sandy soils. Dhofaria is adapted to survive in extreme heat and low water conditions, making it a resilient species in desert environments. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in gardens across the region.
